comments.body: original interface allowed GetUserName to be empty if no auth occurred... can GetUser return nil in that case? should this return `user.Info, bool`?

> original interface allowed GetUserName to be empty if no auth occurred... can GetUser return nil in that case? should this return user.Info, bool?

`nil` seems valid to me.  I don't see a reason to return a `bool` too.

either add the bool or doc the possibility of nil and handle it in the places we call GetUser(). I have a slight preference for the bool, just because it'll make callers realize they need to handle the absence of a user

> either add the bool or doc the possibility of nil and handle it in the places we call GetUser(). I have a slight preference for the bool, just because it'll make callers realize they need to handle the absence of a user

I don't like duplicating information on an API.  If the user can be nil where someone is using this (we don't do that in origin), they can add the check.
